Data Management Plan CELSA/23/024 Machine Learning- Based Coopera Ɵve 
Vehicle and Traﬃc Control Using Secure ML and V2X Communica Ɵons 
Research Data Summary 
List and describe all datasets or research materials that you plan to generate/collect or reuse during 
your research project. For each dataset or data type (observa Ɵonal, experimental etc.), provide a short 
name & descrip Ɵon (suﬃcient for yourself to know what data it is about), indicate whether the data are 
newly generated/collected or reused, digital or physical, also indicate the type of the data (the kind of 
content), its technical format (ﬁle extension), and an es Ɵmate of the upper limit of the volume of the 
data 
 This research aims to inves Ɵgate the applica Ɵon of Reinforcement Learning (RL), which is a type 
of machine learning (ML), within the context of autonomous driving vehicles. The communica Ɵon 
network between these vehicles is o Ōen denoted as V2X. This CELSA project is  a partnership 
between KU Leuven and Budapest Univ. of Technology and Economics (BME). KU Leuven's part is 
speciﬁcally focused on the security aspects of RL in this context. Therefore, the expected outcome 
of KU Leuven’s research will be mostly security architectures for RL-based V2X systems. The 
research work of KU Leuven is exclusively based on simula Ɵon only (no real vehicle , commercial 
products or implementa Ɵons are involved).

If you reuse exis Ɵng ppt/ , please specify the source, preferably by using a persistent iden Ɵﬁer (e.g. 
DOI, Handle, URL etc.) per dataset or data type: 
 During the project we may re- use exisƟng soŌware libraries  or python code sets, in accordance 
with the licenses under which they are published. 
Are there any ethical issues concerning the crea Ɵon and/or use of the data (e.g. experiments on 
humans or animals, dual use)? If so, refer to speciﬁc datasets or data types when appropriate and 
provide the relevant ethical approval number. 
 No 
Will you process personal data? If so, please refer to speciﬁc datasets or data types when appropriate 
and provide the KU Leuven or UZ Leuven privacy register number (G or S number). 
 No. Given that all work related to this is done based on simula Ɵon, all input se ƫngs (vehicle 
data, conﬁgura Ɵon, etc.) are strictly ﬁc ƟƟous. Thus none of the data associated are linkable to  
natural person or other data. 
Does your work have poten Ɵal for commercial valoriza Ɵon (e.g. tech transfer, for example spin -oﬀs, 
commercial exploita Ɵon, …)? If so, please comment per dataset or data type where appropriate.  
 No.  
Do exisƟng 3rd party agreements restrict exploita Ɵon or dissemina Ɵon of the data you (re)use (e.g. 
Material or Data transfer agreements, Research collabora Ɵon agreements)? If so, please explain in the 
comment sec Ɵon to what data they relate and what restric Ɵons are in plac e. 
 No  
Are there any other legal issues, such as intellectual property rights and ownership, to be managed 
related to the data you (re)use? If so, please explain in the comment sec Ɵon to what data they relate 
and which restric Ɵons will be asserted.  
 Yes 
 The soŌware libraries that this code would use may be published under certain restric Ɵve 
licenses. Any so Ōware in this project that builds upon these libraries will be therefore also be 
subject to licenses that take into account the restric Ɵons of the l icenses therein. 
Documenta Ɵon and Metadata  
Clearly describe what approach will be followed to capture the accompanying informa Ɵon necessary 
to keepd ata understandable and usable, for yourself and others, now and in the future (e.g. in terms 
of documenta Ɵon levels and types required, procedures used, Electronic Lab Notebooks, README.txt 
ﬁles, codebook.tsv etc. where this informa Ɵon is recorded).  
 Any soŌware code or script produced during this project will be documented in -ﬁle, according to 
the pracƟces of the relevant language. Also, readme ﬁles will be included alongside, describing 
how to compile and/or operate the so Ōware and how to interpret the output produced.  
Will a metadata standard be used to make it easier to ﬁnd and reuse the data? If so, please specify 
which metadata standard will be used. If not, please specify which metadata will be created to make 
the data easier to ﬁnd and reuse. 
 No 
 Any soŌware code made publicly available will be stored on the github.com website, which is an 
industry reference for open- source so Ōware, on the COSIC research group's github.com page 
(hƩps://github.com/KULeuven -COSIC). It will be named according to the research publica Ɵons 
that refer to it, and links to the source code's page will also be inclu ded in such publica Ɵons. 
Data Storage & Back-up during the Research Project 
Where will the data be stored? 
Other (specify below) 
 The publicly available so Ōware code and scripts will be primarily stored on the COSIC GitHub 
repository (h Ʃps://github.com/KULeuven -COSIC). Code that is not publicly available will be 
stored on the COSIC research group's GitLab infrastructure, which is private and also maintained 
by the ESAT department of the KU Leuven. 
How will the data be backed up? 
 Other (specify below) 
 The publicly accessible COSIC GitHub repository (h Ʃps://github.com/KULeuven -COSIC) is backed 
up automa Ɵcally by GitHub. The COSIC re search group's GitLab infrastructure, is private and also 
maintained by the ICTS services of the ESAT department of the KU Leuven. 
Is there currently suﬃcient storage & backup capacity during the project? 
If no or insuﬃcient storage or backup capaci Ɵes are available, explain how this will be taken care of. 
 Yes 
How will you ensure that the data are securely stored and not accessed or modiﬁed by unauthorized 
persons? 
 During the course of the project, so Ōware code and scripts will be protected by access  rights 
maintained by the ESAT network and within the GitLab. 
What are the expected costs for data storage and backup during the research project? How will these 
costs be covered? 
 The costs of the GitLab maintenance are covered by the COSIC research group as part of the 
general IT costs. The use of GitHub is currently 5USD/month and is funded from general COSIC 
funds. 
Data Preserva Ɵon aŌer the end of the Research Project  
Which data will be retained for 10 years (or longer, in agreement with other reten Ɵon policies that are 
applicable) a Ōer the end of the project? In case some data cannot be preserved, clearly state the 
reasons for this (e.g. legal or contractual restric Ɵons, storage/budget issues, ins ƟtuƟonal policies...).  
 All data will be preserved for 10 years according to KU Leuven RDM policy 
Where will these data be archived (stored and curated for the long-term)? 
 KU Leuven RDR 
 Other (specify below) 
 These data will be archived in several loca Ɵons. First, the ESAT GitLab will hold the code and 
scripts so that it can be easily retrieved for further use by researchers; this data is backed up. 
Second, a copy of the totality of the data will be stored in the KU Leuven RDR 
What are the expected costs for data preserva Ɵon during the expected reten Ɵon period? How will 
these costs be covered? 
Given the small size of the data (at most a few GBytes), the storage cost will either be free of charge, or 
already covered by COSIC's or KU Leuven's IT costs. 
Data Sharing and Reuse 
Will the data (or part of the data) be made available for reuse a Ōer/during the project?  
Please explain per dataset or data type which data will be made available. 
 Yes, as restricted data (upon approval, or ins ƟtuƟonal access only)  
 Yes, as open data 
 Projects that are deemed advanced enough will be made publicly available on COSIC's GitHub 
page, with appropriate licenses. All projects will be stored on COSIC's GitLab so that it can be 
shared (condi Ɵoned on internal approval) with other researchers.  
If access is restricted, pl ease specify who will be able to access the data and under what condi Ɵons. 
 For the projects stored internally on GitLab, approval will be granted to COSIC researchers, or 
aﬃliated, under the condi Ɵon of legi Ɵmate use for further research. This  acts as a sanity check 
so that the technology is not removed from COSIC's internal control without further approval. 
Are there any factors that restrict or prevent the sharing of (some of) the data (e.g. as deﬁned in an 
agreement with a 3rd party, legal restric Ɵons)? 
Please explain per dataset or data type where appropriate. 
 No 
 Some open- source so Ōware libraries used during this project come with licenses that limit their 
commercial use, but no proprietary code will be used so that all projects can be made open-
source without requiring further authorisa Ɵon. 
Where will the data be made available? 
If already known, please provide a repository per dataset or data type. 
 KU Leuven RDR (Research Data Repository) 
 Other data repository (specify below) 
 The data will be made publicly available on COSIC's GitHub account because this is a widely-used 
repository for open- source code. Alterna Ɵve access may be made  available via KU Leuven RDR. 
When will the data be made available? 
 Upon publica Ɵon of research  results 
 Other (specify below) 
 If soŌware projects are in enough of a developed state, they will be made available upon 
publicaƟon of research results.  
Which data usage licenses are you going to provide? 
If none, please explain why. 
 CC-BY 4.0 (data) 
 MIT licence (code) 
The data that is made publicly available will use appropriate licenses to permit the use of the code for 
further research, but prohibit commercial use, in addi Ɵon to respecƟng any licenses of libraries used 
within. 
Do you intend to add a p ersistent iden Ɵﬁer (PID) to your dataset(s), e.g. a DOI or accession number? If 
already available, please provide it here. 
 Yes, a PID will be added upon deposit in a data repository 
 The KU Leuven RDR will be used for this. 
What are the expected costs for data sharing? How will these costs be covered? 
 Given the small size (at most a few GBytes), data sharing is expected to be free of charge. 
Responsibili Ɵes 
Who will manage data documenta Ɵon and metadata during the research project?  
 The authors of the code are responsible. 
Who will manage data storage and backup during the research project? 
 Daniel Ishimwe is the COSIC sysadmin in charge of linking the COSIC GitHub repo and internal 
GitLab repos with the KU Leuven RDR. 
Who will manage data preservaƟon and sharing?  
 Daniel Ishimwe is the COSIC sysadmin in charge of linking the COSIC GitHub repo and internal 
GitLab repos with the KU Leuven RDR. 
Who will update and implement this DMP? 
 The co-supervisors of the project: Takahito Yoshizawa & Dave Singelée
